data.event: The first name for this locality was Conser's Ferry, for Jacob S. Conser, an Oregon Trail pioneer of 1848 who ran a ferry across the Santiam River.
He established the ferry in 1851, and also served as the postmaster of Santiam City.
Jefferson post office was established in 1861, with a name change from Syracuse, and previously, Santiam City.

event.title: 1854 Jacob Conser House, which is listed

data.event: The 1854 Jacob Conser House, which is listed on the National Register of Historic Places, currently serves as the city's library.
